newsitem.title: GERMANY: German call money unchanged at 3.00/3.05 pct.
newsitem.headline: German call money unchanged at 3.00/3.05 pct.

text.p: German call money rates were unchanged at 3.00 to 3.05 percent on Monday as banks remained adequately furnished with cash.

Money dealers said average commercial bank reserves at the central bank looked slightly low but that the Bundesbank could easily make up the shortfall at Wednesday's repo allocation, the last this month.
Only then would it become possible to assess whether banks would have to rely heavily on the Lombard borrowing facility to meet the end-month reserve requirement, dealers said.

Effective commercial bank deposits totalled 39.9 billion marks on Friday, down from Thursday's 40.5 billion marks, while the average for the month through Sunday came to 38.8 billion marks, compared with 38.6 billion.
Lombard borrowings on Friday were unchanged at about 100 million marks. The Frankfurt Interbank Overnight Average FIONA= was 3.04467 percent on Monday, compared with 3.04600 percent on Friday.
